meanings.definition: To make something seem larger, more important, or more extreme than it really is.
meanings.sent1: She tends to overexaggerate her achievements when talking to her friends.
meanings.sent2: It is not good to overexaggerate your abilities in a job interview.
meanings.sent3: His overexaggeration of the fish he caught made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The movie's overexaggeration of reality left the audience in disbelief.
meanings.sent5: The politician's overexaggeration of the issue made headlines.

meanings.definition: The act of exaggerating something to an excessive degree.
meanings.sent1: The comedian's overexaggeration of everyday situations always gets a laugh.
meanings.sent2: Her constant overexaggeration of minor problems makes it hard to take her seriously.
meanings.sent3: The overexaggeration of the size of the cake at the party was amusing.
meanings.sent4: The overexaggeration of his fear of spiders was evident in his reaction.
meanings.sent5: The overexaggeration of the storm in the movie made it thrilling to watch.
